poem:
The Green Divide

In the halls where power whispers  
of net zero and gilded futures,  
the poorest, shadows in the margins,  
bear burdens of promises unkept.  
Beneath the veneer of progress,  
the earth's cry mingles with theirs,  
a silent plea for justice,  
as politicians weave and unweave  
the fragile fabric of hope.
